original_title: Sri Lanka raises fuel quota for cars to 40 litres, bikes 14
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has increased a fuel ration by a third to 40 litres a week for cars and vans while almost doubling the allocation for motor bikes to 14 litres, Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.
“Registered taxi three-wheelers will receive 22 liters, while other three-wheelers will receive 14 liters per week,” Minister Wijesekera said in a Twitter.com message.
Land vehicles will get 45 litres from the current 25 litres.

Sri Lanka imposed weekly fuel quotas after the island’s economists printed money to suppress interest rats and triggered the worst currency crisis in the history of its central bank. (Colombo, May 28, 2023)
